name: Forest Guardians
title: Largest Forest Coverage
description: In 2022, Suriname boasted an impressive 94.52% of its land area covered by forests, making it one of the most forested countries in the world.

name: Debt Dilemma
title: High External Debt Burden
description: As of 2023, Suriname's external debt was 84.36% of its Gross National Income, indicating significant financial obligations on the international stage.

name: Electricity Odyssey
title: Longest Wait for Electricity
description: In 2018, it took an average of 262.3 days to obtain an electrical connection in Suriname, highlighting challenges in infrastructure development.

name: Education Exodus
title: High Female School Dropout
description: By 2023, 82.81% of primary school-aged girls were out of school, reflecting significant challenges in female education retention.

name: Gender Gap in Schools
title: Female Dominance in Secondary Education
description: In 2015, 61.25% of secondary education students were female, indicating a gender imbalance in school attendance.

name: Male Education Struggle
title: Low Male Progression to Secondary School
description: In 2017, only 59.94% of male students progressed to secondary school, highlighting a need for improved male educational support.

name: Agriculture's Small Footprint
title: Minimal Agricultural Land Use
description: In 2022, only 0.45% of Suriname's land was used for agriculture, emphasizing a reliance on other sectors for economic growth.

name: Breastfeeding Challenge
title: Low Exclusive Breastfeeding Rates
description: In 2018, only 8.92% of children under six months were exclusively breastfed, indicating potential public health concerns.
